aboutSection.subtitle: Salut Orphelins et Malades Infectés
aboutSection.title: We believe in fostering resilience, promoting inclusion, and empowering communities
aboutSection.content1: Established in December 2018 in Les Cayes, Haiti. As a non-profit organization, our primary goal is to provide vital assistance to orphaned children and individuals living with HIV/AIDS in Haiti. Despite the numerous challenges faced, including pervasive discrimination, SOMI remains steadfast in its commitment to offering holistic support. We prioritize psychological and economic aid for persons living with HIV/AIDS, ensuring access to treatment and promoting adherence. Additionally, we extend educational assistance and medical care to orphaned children, aiming to alleviate their burdens and foster their growth.
aboutSection.content2: Through our initiatives, we strive to combat stigma, promote social inclusion, and empower communities to build resilient futures. SOMI Haiti is dedicated to making a lasting impact on the lives of those we serve, promoting dignity, hope, and well-being.

content1.title: Health Care
content1.description: We are dedicated to ensuring access to healthcare services for all. Our goal is to provide comprehensive healthcare and support services to individuals living with HIV/AIDS. We strive to improve health outcomes and promote well-being for all.

content2.title: Education
content2.description: We believe that education is the key to unlocking potential. Through scholarships, tutoring, and educational support programs, we aim to empower these children with the knowledge and skills they need to build a brighter future for themselves and their communities.

content3.title: Community Development
content3.description: Strong, resilient communities are the foundation of sustainable development. Our goal is to foster community development through economic empowerment, social inclusion, and infrastructure improvement projects.

questions.question: What is SOMI Haiti?
questions.answer: SOMI Haiti, which stands for 'Salut Orphelins et Malades Infectés,' is a non-profit organization founded in December 2018 by Mme. Rose-Gilène Clotaire in Les Cayes, Haiti. Our mission is to provide support and assistance to orphaned children and individuals living with HIV/AIDS.

questions.question: What services does SOMI Haiti offer?
questions.answer: SOMI Haiti offers a range of services including educational support for orphaned children affected by HIV/AIDS, healthcare services for individuals living with HIV/AIDS, community development initiatives, and advocacy against stigma and discrimination.

questions.question: How can I get involved with SOMI Haiti?
questions.answer: There are several ways to get involved with SOMI Haiti. You can make a donation to support our programs, volunteer your time and skills, participate in fundraising events, or spread awareness about our cause on social media. Visit our 'Get Involved' page for more information.

questions.question: Can I donate to SOMI Haiti?
questions.answer: Yes, you can donate to SOMI Haiti to support our programs and initiatives. Your donations help us provide vital assistance to orphaned children and individuals living with HIV/AIDS in Haiti. Visit our 'Donate' page to learn more about how you can contribute.

questions.question: How does SOMI Haiti ensure transparency and accountability?
questions.answer: SOMI Haiti is committed to transparency and accountability in all aspects of our operations. We regularly publish financial reports and updates on our website, and we adhere to strict financial management practices to ensure that donor funds are used effectively and efficiently.

questions.question: Does SOMI Haiti work with other organizations?
questions.answer: Yes, SOMI Haiti collaborates with a network of local and international organizations, government agencies, and community groups to maximize our impact and reach. We believe in the power of partnerships and work closely with other stakeholders to achieve our goals.
